dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the cleat of basepath speedster MAURY WILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen years later, after The Babe was gone, there was another guy who had something to do with the legend getting made too. A guy who set a record that summer that was so awesome, some people still don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: so fast that no one knows he's gone. The Pitcher fires to rd. The 3rd BASEMAN gloves the dirt. The UMPIRE wings the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLS' CLEAT becomes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE P.F. FLYER SNEAKER of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...BENNY RODRIGUEZ, as he steps up to the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cranks one deep to right. He tears around the bases like lightning (this kid is real fast). He rounds 3rd. The bal comes in home - cutting him off. He's caught in a pickle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YEAH-YEAH, HAM, DeNUNEZ, REPEAT, TIMMY, BERTRAM and SQUIN come unglued and crowd the basepath.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: PICKLE
dialogues.text: BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pickles the CATCHER and 3RD BASEMAN. He feints n' rubba-l them out of position. He sprints for home. Safe! Just as he crosses home plate  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulls his transistor radio ear plug out.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-one! Maury Wills just stole number thirty-one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: throws their gloves 9 different ways in disgust.  OTHER TEAM (ABOUT BENNY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap! Can't beat that guy! Ya dufuses, why'd ya get him in a pickle for?! Ya know he's the damn pickle king! Rubba legs for sure! Truly rubba legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They imitate the big leaguers; skinning five, spittin' 'z chaw-juice. Yeah-Yeah hands Benny his glove. Squints jots the stats in his pee-chee folder.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game over. Sixteen zip. Murderers' Row remains undefeated.  OPPONENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! We never got our ups!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lunch bell RINGS. The gang heads across the playgroun back to the bungalows.  OPPONENT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All your moms wear boxers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking back, eight "birds" hit the air. Nervous, NEW- KID   5     SCOTTY SMALLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has been watching nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Ham, Squints and Benny go for the 3 spigots, Yeah Yeah taps each rapidfire:  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milk-milk-pee.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, I'm dyin' a thirst and you pee me out!  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ham, it ain't really.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then switch with me.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone drinks from the 2 "un-cursed" spigots. Ham last. As they turn to leave, Scotty goes for the fountain. The guys hang - waiting for doom. Scotty drinks from the pee spigot! The guys GAG and FAUX-BARF. Scotty has no idea wh they're laughing at him.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I moved to the neighborhood about a month before school let out. I was from another state, and didn't have a single friend in a thousand miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny, Ham, Scotty (sitting by himself) and the other STU are clock watching. The BELL RINGS. Summer vacation! The classroom empties... papers circle to the floor from 35 departing cyclones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streams of excited KIDS spill into the corridors - a rive scrambling tennis shoes and clashing lunch boxes at the entrance gate.  SCOTTY'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: caught in the mayhem.    6     HE SPIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the 8 guys forging ahead. He follows them.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a lousy way to end up the 5th grade, 'cause I had zip time to make friends before summer. And that's about where it all started...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty sneaks close around some dense bushes, clutching b and "John Glenn - Freedom 7" lunchbox. He steps through t barrier (a secret doorway in the fence) onto the distant OUTFIELD OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang's homemade baseball diamond. They're:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with broken brooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with halves of tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with a holed box of detergent powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of leaves, trash and sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in left field - painted green and lettered "The Green Mon  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: maintains cover and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a row of houses, whose backyards are all chain link fence The fencing is trimmed individually in wood, bamboo etc.. One has the world's coolest treehouse. Next to it... is t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: last house. This owner has cordoned his backyard - tall p of that green "tropical-look" privacy fiberglass lashed t the fence.   7     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: remains undercover, but he's bustin' to join in.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: never notices him. As they work:  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth grade's history, man. A hundred days, man. A Hundred days of baseball. All Day, everyday, as much as we can. That's the best.  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got all summer.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got all summer.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's play.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah... let's play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys round up in the infield. As they play catch, the spread farther and farther apart... until they've each ta up the position they most like to play. They fit the palt little diamond; scrappy, happy kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tract homes - everybody's got a different thing going in front yard. The guys (sans Timmons') split up toward thei homes - slappin' gloves, "so-longing" for the night.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone but the Timmons twins lived on my new block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, shuttling moving boxes to his garage, watches the go.  NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lived in a house by the sandlot and had the world's greatest tree house, because their dad was a contractor.    8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny is the last to go in. He sees Scotty watching. So, nods... just a little.  THE BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: clears to empty. The street lamps arc on, drawing soft wh circles on the sidewalks. FROM THIS HEIGHT, they look lik baseballs dotting the neighborhood.  NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even before I knew any of them I envied that tree house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shrine to the pastime. Pennants, magazine pictures, gam programs, baseball cards, a whole section of Maury Wills, radiating from a picture of Wills caught in a pickle.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...later, it would become second only to Cape Canaveral as a command post for history. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I moved in that summer, I'd never played baseball, but it wasn't too tough figuring out who these guys' heroes were. So, after a week of watching... I figured baseball seemed like the best way to get in with them.  BENNY'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in bed, oiling his glove, staring out his window at Scott house. Taped to his footboard is the most important pictu of all... a picture of The Babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jr. Chemistry set. Heath Kit gadgets. An unbelievable Ere Set contraption with little motors and stuff. An autograp picture of Mr. Wizard. Scotty's pj'd at his erector set t bothered and unhappy. This stuff is too damn easy for him He whips on a last bolt and connects the itty-bitty motor SWITCHES ON  THE CONTRAPTION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a tiny scoopelvator snatches up a white marble. Drops it a roller coaster track. The marble whips around corners a     9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: loop-da-loops... lands in a mini-catapult. Another motor draws it back via a winding string. Boy Scout camping-kni scissors ratchet in - snip the string - the catapult fire  THE MARBLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leaps a little green fence and WONK! Ouuuhhh! beans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: right in the forehead.  BEDROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty winces at the shot.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mom.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we agreed we'd take this apart... and not spend so much time in here.  SCOTTY (FEELING LOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know - but it's just nighttime.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, have you made any friends yet?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not, honey?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I'm still "new."  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I don't want you sitting in here all summer fiddling with this stuff, like you did last summer... and the one before that. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, look at me. I know you're smart, and I'm proud of you. But you have to get outside, you have to... play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits across from him, trying to get through.     10     MOM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to get out in the fresh air and make friends. Run around and scrape your knees. Get dirty. Climb trees and hop fences. Get in trouble for crying out loud. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too much, but some. You have my permission. Now how many mothers do you think say that to their sons?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None mothers I guess.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to make friends this summer, Scotty. Lots of them.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I don't - I'm no good at anything. Face it, Mom, I'm just an EGGHEAD -  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and you'll always be just an egghead with an attitude like that. So promise me, alright?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe tomorrow you'll make some friends.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe tomorrow. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? Do you think Bill - I mean Dad - will teach me to play catch?  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, he'd love it, you know what an athlete he wasIn high school. (ALTERMNATE LINE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what a pitcher he was in high college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty slurps a glass of chocolate Quick. Rinses the glas too carefully. Gathers courage for something. Breathes de starts across the house. 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty peeks through a slightly open door. BILL moves aro inside, unpacking boxes. Scotty reaches to knock. Stops. Almost walks away. Then musters the gumption. KNOCKS.

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty takes a few cautious steps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a trophy room. Ribbons, plaques, trophies. Bill must'v been some athlete; but he limps now. Scotty lingers... gathering more courage.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My real dad died when I was just a little kid. My mom married Bill a year before we moved to the neighborhood. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the time, he and I were still getting used to each other.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Dad - sorry, I mean Bill, remember you promised you'd teach me to play catch?  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um hum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dusts a batting trophy.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, could you teach me?  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places a pitching plaque. Scotty waits awkwardly. Wait for more words. They don't come.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Great. Thanks.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um hum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty leaves, bringing the door with him on his way out. Through the cracked portal he sees Bill set a silver pede on the main shelf. On this he sets a baseball...   12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just a baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty wakes up. Checks his (Theme) clock. 8:30. He bolts out of bed. Dashes through the house to the front door. Throws it open and runs down to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the sidewalk. Fan sprinklers water all the lawns. Way far down the block  HE GLIMPSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ham, at the HELMS BAKERY TRUCK, buying a donut, then scra around the far corner.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-hey, come on! Wait up - wait up!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: panics. Runs back inside and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...strips off his cowboy pj's. Redresses. Digs through hi  CLOSET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: finding a vinyl, "toy" baseball glove. It's still in the package, with a note attached: "To Scotty Boy - Love, Gra It's all he's got. He shovels through a pair of Mickey Mo ears - a cowboy hat - finds the closest thing he's got to baseball cap... a long, duck-billed fishing cap with a bi embroidered trout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty runs by (soon familiar places):  A 5 & DIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where he slows momentarily, envious of the crisply unifor kids... wow. Moving on down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: whose backyards we already know. Scotty flat out stops at   13     THE HOUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the fiberglass panels out back. Scary place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty slips quietly through the secret fence doorway, em IN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where he hugs the perimeter, moving slowly toward the san common houses. Winded, Scotty finds  THE GANG'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: already playing "over the line."  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never kept score. They never chose sides. They never even really stopped playing the game... it just went on forever. Everyday they picked up right where they left off the day before. It was an endless "dream game." (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was only 8 of them, so they didn't have a whole team. It didn't matter though... Benny was so good he took everyone's position when it was there ups. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know any of that then... I  just knew they were having the time of their lives and I wanted to be a part of it.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watches and listens (as he goes) to the SHARP, satisfying sound of the hardball, SNAPPING CLEANLY in the oily leath of their gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his own toy glove... how embarrassing.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: continues around the perimeter, trying to be seen and bec invisible. He goes unwittingly CLOSER TO those green fiberglass panels. 14     DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: winds up and pitches to  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who connects big. CRACK!  SCOTTY'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: come too close to the green fence. Something has overcome him... fear! He stares with serious woollies at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and sees only dust rising in time with some great, SOUNDS EXHALATION. And then, before he can draw any conclusions. disaster.

dialogues.speaker: GANG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! Look out!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: whips a look up and sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming right at him.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tracks it, frozen stiff. Scared shitless. At the past possible moment, he throws his arms over his face and duc social suicide.  THE BALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: beans him at the glove covering his noggin.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hits his butt. The ball rolls a bit. Comes to an "I-dare- you" stop: right up against the diseased fiberglass panel that preternatural fence. Scotty pulls his arms away from his face.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHS uproariously.  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice catch!    15     REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice catch!  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Throw the ball back!  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, hurry up!  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta a game here, man!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves for the ball. As he goes, he sweats:  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay, I'll get it! (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a goofus - don't be a goofus - don't be a goofus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the fence and the ball and stops. It's hard to move. The force emanating from the backyard has got him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: keeps perfect time with the monster-breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves. It scares the living kapok out of  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who snatches up the ball and back-pedals 10 feet.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws back the ball. And his chances of getting in wi these guys are over. Because Scotty... throws like a girl  THE BALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: droops forward in the air. Lands 6 feet from him. Rolls slowly up to the gang, finally coming to a dainty stop at DeNunez' feet.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks from the ball to Scotty... they CRACK UP!     16     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: walks away... crying.  SCOTTY (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life is over.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is the only one that isn't laughing. He stares the others down.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Benny-man, didn't you see that throw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He imitates it, "flipping" his glove to Ham. The gang BUS UP again.  HAM (TRULY STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kid's got the gaw'damn panty- waistiest arm I ever saw in my whole life.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen a guy once that threw like that. I mean not that bad, but at least so bad that he hadda move in the fourth grade 'cause they nicknamed him "Bloomers."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny's look stifles the bunch.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet not one of you knows how The Babe got his nickname.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, 'cause of the way he looked like a little kid face.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull, it's just 'cause he liked kids and stuff.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. The Babe was called The Babe, because he was like the child of Yankee Stadium.   17     BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. You're all full of crap. George Herman Ruth got his nickname because his mom died when he was just a little kid, and he hadda go live in an orphanage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. None of the other guys has heard this before.  BENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody liked him there. The bigger guys picked on him all the time. And when they messed with him he couldn't fight back, 'cause he was just... like scared. So when they messed with him, he cried about it. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cried... so they called him The Babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hits home real good.  BENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya think that kid just felt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny exits the sandlot, leaving the others with a lesson learned.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone knew Benny was different. Nobody ever voted or anything, but he was the leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Benny goes into his house, the other's round the corne far behind him.  THE MOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is up. Full. Like a big baseball.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though he seemed like a regular guy, he wasn't. Benny was special, and he was loyal. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they'd all tried out for youth league, they'd all made it. But when they found out they'd have to play on different teams, Benny told 'em that if they couldn't play together, they shouldn't play at all. So, they stayed together. 18

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny's at the window, clutching a baseball, staring over Scotty's house.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, the only person that ever felt sorry for me 'cause I was such a weenie was Benjamin Franklin Rodriguez. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though neither of us knew it at the time, we were connected. Like I had been born for just that one moment, when I would perform the world's all- time boner, and Benny would bail me out. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connected as friends... born to meet for just that one moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We DRIFT OFF Benny to his PICTURE OF MAURY WILLS in a pic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PICTURE OF MAURY WILLS on a Post Super Sugar Crisp box.  BILL & SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the table. Bill sifting through mounds of paperwork. S eating breakfast. Scotty's spoon CLANGS one too many time Bill looks up at him.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty picks up his bowl and cereal, goes into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where his mom is making coffee.  MOM (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?...  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too busy, Mom.  MOM (ENCOURAGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back in there and ask. He'll take the time. Go on. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty comes back in. Stops mutely near Bill. Long, agoni seconds pass. Finally:  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Da -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick look toward the kitchen, then:  SCOTTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (so Mom won't hear) - I mean, Bill. Could we... I mean could you, like you said - teach me to catch today?  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yeah, but later, okay? I gotta get this done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't much, but it's something.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom comes in behind Scotty.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, can't you take a break and teach him now?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, it's okay - (NOBODY'S LISTENING)  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I said I would and I will. I'm just under the gun here, ya know?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, really -  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - How long could it take? You can't spare a half hour to show him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill drops his pen. Checks his watch. A lost battle here.  BILL (ANNOYED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Alright. I'll get my glove. Come on.     20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill exits past them. Scotty's been "Mom-embarrassed." Sh looks at him:  MOM (CLUELESS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. See. Told you so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty shuffles out back, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eye on the ball. Put the glove up where it goes. Okay?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darn. Sorry.

dialogues.text: Bill's a little amazed at that one. He checks his watch.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright, just throw it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty eagerly retrieves it. Turns to throw - deja vu - h runs over, hands Bill the ball.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs back across the yard. Turns 'round again. Holds h glove up stiffly.  SCOTTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill cannot believe this. Checks his watch again.     21     BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eye on the ball. Put the glove up where the ball goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws again. The ball bounces off the toy glove - bre the webbing.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darn. My glove got -  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - not bad. Right side at least. Now, just throw it back this time.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my glove -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's looking at his watch again. Scotty fetches the bal gulps - "flips" it back.  BILL (DISBELIEF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny comes out of his house. From the sidewalk  BENNY'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: up the side of Scotty's house into the backyard. He can s Scotty. Only Scotty. Standing there game as hell, trying catch balls that seem to be coming too fast. The ball com Scotty ducks. The ball hits the block wall behind him, caroming back toward where we assume Bill is throwing fro  BENNY'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drawing the wrong conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's still game. Bill's at ropes end. Check his watch again.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Scott, listen, this one's gonna come right at you, easy, okay?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay.   22     BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your eye on the ball and put your glove up. You'll catch it.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: throws.  THE BALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes slowly forward.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sticks his glove up.  SCOTTY'S EYES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: widen.  THE BALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hits dead center glove. Rips the "toy" webbing. Flies thr AND CLOUTS  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: right in the eye.  BILL  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - God, whadda jerk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's mom comes unglued.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill! What happened?!  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he -   23     SCOTTY (PRIDE'S SAKE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - just took my eye off the ball, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's mom pulls his hand away from his eye. Great shin Bill grabs a steak from the fridge, FLOPS it over Scotty' eye.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Keep that on for an hour. It'll still be black, but it won't swell. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. We'll try again soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty emerges. Sits on the porch. Pitiful and forlorn. Chin in his hands, he looks across the street. He starts. His hand moves to cover his black eye... but he thinks th better of it.  BENNY'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on the curb across the street. A moment goes by. Benny ra a hand.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly waves back.  BOTH

dialogues.text: Benny comes over to Scotty's sidewalk.  BENNY

dialogues.text: Gonna go play some ball. Need a extra guy. Wanna go?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. Thanks.  BENNY

dialogues.text: Why not? Doncha like baseball?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. But, ah...  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.text: Scotty searches for a quick way out of this. Gets it:     24     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my glove's busted. So, ya know, I can't go. Thanks, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny reaches behind his back. Takes something out of his jeans - like he's going for a gun. Smiles a little.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers it to Scotty... a "real" glove.  BENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Scotty SHOUTS over his shoulder:  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! I'm gonna go play some ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move away down the block.  SCOTTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Cool glove.  BENNY

dialogues.text: Yeah. Cool shiner. We gotta stop by the 5 & 10 first. Need a new ball. And chaw and stuff, ya know?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  BENNY

dialogues.text: You dip chaw?  SCOTTY (COMPLETELY CLUELESS)

dialogues.text: Sure. A'course.

dialogues.text: Benny grabs a new baseball on the stride, and handful of bazooka from a jar on the soda fountain counter. He leave the money and exits. Scotty follows. 25

dialogues.text: Benny and Scotty come upon the gang (all their mouths are full a' bazooka) as Ham's chompin' on a candy cigar doing BABE IMITATION:  HAM

dialogues.text: Hey! Check me out! I'm the Great Bambino!

dialogues.text: The gang laughs.  SCOTTY (OVER EAGER)

dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.text: The gang stifles. They're none-to-pleased. Ham sees why. The new kid... "flipper." Eight pairs of eyes burn holes his little soul.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... (BEYOND HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you born in a barn, man?  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, what planet are you from?  SQUINTS

dialogues.text: You never heard of The Sultan of Swat?!  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Titan of Terror!  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colossus of Clout!  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colossus of Clout!  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even he's amazed) The King of Krash!  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea who they were talking about. But there was no way I could let them know that... so, I lied.   26     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! The Great Bambino! Of course. I thought you said The Great Bambi.  HAM (SHIVERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wimpy deer?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yeah - I guess. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang goes SILENT. They spit - they're tough. Scotty dribbles - he's wimpy.  BENNY (W/MOUHTFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Scott, this is Ken DeNunez; Alan McClennan, we call him Yeah-Yeah; Hamilton Porter, we call him Ham; Tommy and Timmy Timmons, Bertram Grover Weeks, and Mike "Squints" Palledorus. (TO GANG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Scott Smalls.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang just stares.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna play with us. He makes nine. Now we got a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pack follows Benny onto the diamond. Scotty trails af them.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you bring him for, Benny?  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause there's eight of us, and he makes nine.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so would my sister, but I didn't bring her!  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With nine Guys we got a whole team.   27     HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, with Elswenger we had a whole team, and Elswenger could throw!  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't game, Benny. He can't throw for nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty drifts off by himself. He can hear what's exchange  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny, you already play all the empty positions since Elswenger moved to Arizona.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I get to rotate 8 positions instead of 7. I need the practice.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't. It's stupid, Benny. The kid's an L-7 weenie.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, Oscar Mayer even.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, Squints, and you're Willie freakin' Mays. You catch like a dork - anybody ever bust your chops about that?  SQUINTS (PALTRY EXCUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm - ya know, I'm -  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and you run like a duck, Yeah- Yeah.  YEAH-YEAH (IT'S TRUE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay-'kay... But I'm -  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - part-a the game.  SQUINTS (DEFENSIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah.     28     BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come he don't get to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's got an answer for that one. Base up you blockhea  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hits the field. Their suspicious glares aren't lost on  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing off by himself, kinda lost. Benny comes over.  BENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: You take right field, Smalls.  SCOTTY (EAGER)

dialogues.text: Right. Okay. Ah... where exactly is that?  BENNY (SURPRISED)

dialogues.text: takes home plate worried: "Maybe the kid is a weenie."  INFIELD

dialogues.text: Repeat at 3rd, stabs it effortlessly and fires to 2nd. Ti snatches it down and drag-tags the invisible base runner, then fires to Bertram at 1st. SNAP! Outta there. Bertram throws back to DeNunez. Benny's ready:  BENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: arcs up... comes down right at  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who raises the glove, and skippers around, as if he were tracking a falling leaf. The ball lands 5 feet behind him   29     THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Sorry, sorry.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is stunned.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: runs back to right field. Ready again - a game kid.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: trots out after him.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you can throw it ya know.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't... I don't know how. (LUMPY THROAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, thanks for taking me here... but I think better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty turns to leave. Benny grabs his arm.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think too much. I bet you get straight A's and shit, huh?  SCOTTY

dialogues.text: No, I got a B once. Actually it was an A minus. (QUICK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it shoulda been a B.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is baseball, you're not supposed to think, you're just supposed to play. (BEAT)

dialogues.text: You ever have a paper route?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I helped a guy one time.    30     BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw it like you chuck a paper. When your arm gets here... just let go of it. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty nods. Benny starts back.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - how do I catch it?  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Just stand there and stick your glove in the air. I'll take care of it.  HOME PLATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny mentally calculates the distance. Puts a little rub the ball. Flips it into the air...  BENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smalls, get one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and swings through deliberately. CRACK!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees it coming. Stands there stiffly. Sticks his glove up closes his eyes.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, catch it. Please, catch it. Please, ca -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAP! His glove swings down. He opens his eyes. Looks int his glove. The ball is there. He takes it out and chucks the ball like a folded paper.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: catches it good and solid at 1st.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Hey, let's play ball!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: loosens up. From home plate    31     BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gives him a "Thumbs Up." The significance of this is only outweighed by his sudden fear, when...  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: glimpses something.  SCOTTY'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of some great, lumbering thing moving past a crack in tho green fiberglass panels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In good spirits, the guys break off to their houses.  SCOTTY & BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: split up in the middle of the street between their homes.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already at his door, Benny just raises his glove in answe  SCOTTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, here - your glove.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty opens a new writing tablet, and titles the page: "Baseball Stuff to Remember." He writes: "1. The Great Bambino?" He hasn't got a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny coaches Scotty. Correct batting stance and swing. B thumb-flicks bottle caps at Scotty from a coffee can full They're tough to hit. But soon Scotty's tagging every one them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeNunez fires - fastball. CRUNCH!   32     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tags it. The ball sails over  SQUINTS'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head in center. From left field  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gives Scotty another "Thumbs Up." The kid's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints arrives with a box of baseball cards.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyday, first thing, we'd all pick a card from what we called "The Dugout."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints shakes it up. Everybody picks one.  NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a shoe box, but whoever we picked, we got to be when it was our ups. One day, when Ham took his pick a little too seriously, the guys let me in on the world's most terrifying secret...  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo! Maury Wills!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey Mou - ah, Mantle.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hey, Willie Mays.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan Musial.  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou Brock.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou Brock - I mean, Luis Aparicio.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Robinson.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Bob Uecker.    33     HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank Aaron. I'm up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang "peppers"  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at home plate) mercilessly.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pitches - strike. Pitches again - strike. Delivers and  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes a Ruthian cut at it. CONNECTS to deep right.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tracks it.  THE BALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes down.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: runs beneath it - glove up.  THE BALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drops into a backyard. The one with the green fiberglass panels.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stops short. Looks back to  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who're already packing up in slumped dejection.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: makes a decision. Swallows against fear of the fence. He takes one step toward that fence.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec, I'll get it!   34     THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes unglued.  GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush over - grab Scotty - pull him back 10 feet into "Fear-Free" zone.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap, you coulda been killed!  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah - truly! Whadda you doin'?!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you were all leavin', so I thought I'd just -  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - if you were thinkin' you wouldn't a thought that!  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go back there, Smalls.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how do we get the ball?  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever even.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, it's a memory.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game's over. We'll get a new one tomorrow. Just forget it. We'll never see it again.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?     35     GANG (HUSHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty stares at them; all heads hung.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go over there, real slow, and be quiet. Don't touch the fence, just peek through that hole in the green stuff... go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Scotty goes forward, the gang steps back.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: draws his eye close to the hole in the fence. WE SEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIMITED VIEW of 3 feet square. WE SEE nothing but the ball... in the small crater it's made in the dirt. There oddly similar craters in the immediate vicinity. Those cr are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes down from out of nowhere. As it CLEARS FRAME, the baseball is gone. Only the crater remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty snaps his head away from the hole - runs over to  THE GANG:  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something got the ball! (UNNERVED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that thing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considered looks are exchanged, then, in unison:  GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aglow. (NOTE: Same as Sc. 80)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Boy Scout lantern. Professionally built structure. The gang's got sleeping bags. They're roasting marshmallows o a Cub Scout camping stove.   36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ham's brought personal s'mores supplies.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna s'more?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some more of what?  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You wanna s'more?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had anything yet, so how can I have any more of nothing?  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kill me Smalls. Look, these are s'mores stuff. Pay attention: (CONCOCTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you take the graham - you put the chocolate on the graham, Hershey's of course - you hold the chocolate on the graham while you roast the mallow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. The mallow flames to life.  HAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -then when the mallow's flamin', ya stuff it on the chocolate and cover it with the other end. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, you scarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ham does. The junk squirts half way down his shirt.  HAM (CONT'D) (BARELY INTELLIGIBLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda messy... Good though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints turns the lantern down low...  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, listen up. (TO SCOTTY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time DeNunez heard this story he FAINTED -  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Bull, Squints!  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeNunez shuts up. It's true.   37     SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Yeah-Yeah heard it he peed his pants.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Squints - did not!  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did, man.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when The Ham heard it he barfed up two bags of marshmallows.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar! It was only one.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So stay away from the door... you might fall out. And don't sit on your sleeping bag... you could shit your pants. (SOLEMN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolute silence. Kid-reverence equals fright.  SQUINTS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The legend of The Beast goes back a long time... before any of us could pick up a baseball. Back to a place called Mertle's Acres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A legendary place... benefitting from years of kid- embellishment: a gothic, scrapyard fortress oddly designe keep something in not out.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Beast belongs to Mr. Mertle, the guy that used to own Mertle's Acres Junkyard. And nobody's ever seen him since the day it happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blurbling pockets of super-heated muck.     38     BURNED-OUT SHELLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of twisted vehicles - strewn carcasses. A battlefield.  OLD APPLIANCES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: that form tortured faces in the shadowy recesses.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mertle's Acres was a bitchin' place, that had everything you could ever imagine.  OTHER STUFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: like savaged shopping carts. A school bus graveyard. Scra motorbikes. Cargo ship buoy balls. The gutted shell of a fighter plane.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And the stuff was worth a fortune. So, one day Mr. Mertle got him this new pup from the pound. They were glad to get rid of him, on account of while he'd been there, he'd killed three dogs bigger than he was. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was exactly what Mr. Mertle figured he needed to protect his junkyard, 'cause people kept stealing stuff at night, when he wasn't around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a maze of dark, grimy junk-passageways.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So he bought The Beast, and set him loose in Mertle's Acres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the end of a passage. (NOTE: We never fully see The Be

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Beast was still just a pup of six months, but he already weighed a 150 pounds... and he kept gettin' bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: full of meat hits the ground - disappears. SLIFFTHT! It spits back INTO FRAME... empty and tattered.    39

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He threw The Beast a trash bag full of meat every night, and just left him alone. All alone in the whole place by himself... to grow.  AN EYEBALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: among a pile of broken headlights. As big as the headligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: like Mannequins, with bite-chunks missing. Plastic flamin brutally mangled. A decapitated "lawn jockey." A plastic cow, legs gnawed off. And BREATHING... amongst the artifi "life" forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the center of an old truck tire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving powerfully - as tall as a burned-out VW.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so, in a few months, the pup grew into The Beast. And he grew big as a car. And he grew mean, 'cause nobody liked him, and he didn't like nobody either. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so he only had one thing on his mind... to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO THIEVES in ski-masks. Suddenly, a HEATED WIND strips their masks. Two elephantine feet come down on their face They SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And he did. And he liked it.  ANOTHER THIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: suddenly enveloped by a shadow. He's dragged into darknes he SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: load their van and take off. They skid. CRUNCH! The van caves in. The Thieves are dragged out, BLATHERING in horr    40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beast moves like a murderous phantom. WE HEAR ROARING and primordial bloodlust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are tossed hither and yon... mixed in with fake flamingoe and a flying plastic cow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars. DETECTIVES speak with MR. MERTLE; his should slumped, his eyes moist. They show him file photos of (TH in ski masks.)

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Beast was the most perfect junkyard dog that ever lived... a true killing machine. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After awhile, the police started getting phone calls from people, reporting all the missing thieves. The ones The Beast had killed... it added up to about 37 guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle solemnly heads inside the junkyard.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But they never found a single body... not one. Some people say they all got away, and were just so scared that they ended up in insane asylums and stuff. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we know what really happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle emerges from the junkyard. Cops take cover beh their cars. Guns are leveled toward Mr. Mertle and what follows him at the end of a rusty tow chain.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Beast... ate them. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ate them bones and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE slam their windows - draw their curtains. LITTLE K are snatched up by PARENTS, who run inside and lock their doors.     41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leads the The Beast on a huge chain. (NOTE: We only see b of The Beast.)

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Beast was good at his guarddog job. Too good. So the cops said he had to be retired. But he didn't have to be killed or nothin', on account of there was no evidence... no bones... no teeth for dental records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The green fiberglass panels are brand new here in the pas

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The police told Mr. Mertle that if wanted to keep The Beast, he hadda lock him in his backyard, so he could never get out.  A CRANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lowers a giant bathtub into the backyard. FIREMEN fill it with water.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And that he hadda chain him up, so's in case he tried to get out to eat children and stuff, he couldn't.  CONSTRUCTION WORKERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sink an I-Beam girder. Cement fills the chasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: contructs a huge lean-to from old bullet-holed, tin-ad si  A WELDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braises chain to the girder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "collars" The Beast with the other end.  THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: disappears beneath the lean-to. DUST EXPLODES from undern as he lies down.    42

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle asked the cops how long he had to keep his pup chained up like a slave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICEMAN "mouths" the word, "F-O-R-E-V-E-R."

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They said... until forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ham drools mallow goop. His hands are fisted tight... 'ma squirt out twixt his clenched fingers.  REPEAT & TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: have their pillows 'round their heads like bonnets.  DENUNEZ & YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stare and shake.  BERTRAM'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eyes are shut tight, his bottom lip shudders.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gulps.  SCOTTY'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting shattered. He checks his pants to see if he's pee them. His mallow's a briquette. It SPUTTERS and flames ou  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is proud of his story prowess.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so... The Beast sits there under that lean-to, dreaming about the time when he can break the chain and get out... dreaming of the time when he can chase and kill again.    43     THE GANG  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, man. That's why you can't go over there. Nobody ever has. Nobody ever will.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One kid did, but nobody ever seen him again.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't true -  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - yeah it is! He got eaten!  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah - that kid who went to get his kite... what was his name?  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Boogers" Fleming?  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was that guy with the warts on his face.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davy "The Toad."  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solemnity spreads among them. Kid-reverence.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davy "The Toad" Stodenrous.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, The Toad...  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, poor Toad.  SCOTTY (WEAK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh... none of that's true. You guys are just -  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - oh, yeah?... Come here. Stick your head out the window and look down.    44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty goes slowly... He sticks his head out guillotinely through the small square opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's head comes out turtle-like. The tree house overh the common wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle's backyard and SEES an old footed bathtub fill with murky water. A steel pole, cemented into the center the yard. A tow chain, snaking away from the pole and vanishing under the lean-to. Dust rises and falls from 'n the lean-to.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hears the ORGANIC EXHAUST that accompanies the dust... ri and falling... in POWERFUL EXHALATIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty pulls his head back, scared shitless.  SCOTTY (HUSHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's down there!  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet he is.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever goes over that fence... stays there.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It becomes the property of The Beast... Forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NOTE: Same as Sc. 54) FROM THE SANDLOT... a FULL MOON ha ominously over the tree house; a glowing little box of de in the scary night.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned that more than a 150 baseballs had gone over that fence... and not one of them was ever seen again. Even when some brave kid worked up enough courage to peek over the fence. (MORE)    45     NARRATOR (CONT'D) (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, when they went over, they vanished. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it was true, because when I looked down in there, I didn't see a single... solitary... one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FIVE & DIME - MORNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints and Yeah-Yeah come out of the store in a big hurr with a new baseball in a box. They stop momentarily - ope it and chuck the box. Yeah-Yeah rams his mouth full of 'z WHILE  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spits into his palm and rubs the ball to get the shine of His eyes go suddenly wide and he stares, and oggles, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: about 19-years-old walks by into the store. She smiles at Squints.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: can only manage a totally embarrassing goofy grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are waiting anxiously as Yeah-Yeah and Squints r over. Yeah-Yeah tosses Benny the ball. He rubs it up. Pas it along. They all take a turn.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you so long?! We been here forever already!  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints was pervin' a dish.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, I wasn't!  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah you were! Yer tongue was hangin' outta yer head and you was swoonin'! (SWOONIN')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-oh Wendy Peffercorn my darling lover girl...    46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints goes for Yeah-Yeah. Ham holds him back.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold me back! Hold me back!  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am holdin' you back Squints.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Well, lemme go then. (CALMS)  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where'd you get the money this time Yeah-Yeah?  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah-yeah! It was great! So I went around pretended like I was selling perscriptions to magazines. And the people asked if they should pay me now. So I said yeah-yeah, pay me now! And they did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are astonished.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonavabitch!  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-what?! I'll take it back. I know it was crappy, but I didn't have no money, I -  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - naw, don't, man. He's just mad he didn't think of it.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know how many lawns I hadda mow when it was my turn?! Geez. Let's play.  THE SUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crests the sandlot... it's gonna be a hot one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real hot one. Ham sweats uncontrollably. His lunch bag drips PB&J.   47     DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spits a 'zooka sploink that SIZZLES when it hits.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: simultaneously heads for the bleachers. Everybody but Ben FINALLY:  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take it no more, Benny. I'm bakin' like a toasted cheeser!  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hotter than the fires of hell.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hotter than a fish in a fryin' pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brothers "look" at each other on the miscue.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, don't be wimpy.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face it, Benny. It's not a fit day out for man nor beast. We gotta call it for the day.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vote then. Everyone that wants to be a can't-hack-it panty waist, and wear their momma's bra, raise your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all raise their hands. Grinning.  BENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Be like that. So what're we gonna do then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, as if Benny's gone quite mad... SO OBVIOUS:  GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scam Pool Honeys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEENAGE POOL HONEYS arranged particularly on their beach along the deck, soak up the rays in their polka-dot bikin   48     THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rushes out in cut-off shorts, and banzais the shallow end Ham leaps over the water like a graceful Manatee.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamonball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KERSPLASH! A Ham-tsunami SLOSHES the Coppertone'd bods of  POOL HONEYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're up and SCREAMING at him.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny would've played ball all day and all night... rain shine, tidal wave, whatever, it didn't matter. Baseball was the only thing he cared about and everything else was just a waste of time. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, of all the things we ever did besides baseball, goin' to the pool was what he tolerated best. Even though none of us had ever seen a Playboy magazine - which we constantly lied about - we figured the pool was the next best thing to being there.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dunks each other, play "attack-sub," etc...  NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't the Pool Honeys like we said, 'cause if any one of them had come up to any one of us, we'd of peed our pants. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went for... the Lifeguard.  THE LIFEGUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is unbelievable. In fact, it's WENDY PEFFERCORN. She slid Coppertone up and down her legs.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one by one, stop foolin' around. Chest deep in the shallo end, they're a detached and frozen pocket of leering dope The OTHER 80 KIDS in the pool play on around them.     49     SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is suddenly afflicted.  NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one day, it became too much for Michael "Squints" Palledorous. And he did the most desperate thing any of us had ever seen.  THE LIFEGUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oils up and down.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gawks on. (Cool Hand Luke scene):  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man...  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, too cruel.  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't know what she's doing.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't know what she's doing.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah she does. She knows exactly what she's doing.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've swum here every summer of my adult life... and every summer there she is. (LOSING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotioning... oiling... smiling. (TEETH CLENCHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I - can't - take - this - no - more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pushes through the water, pulls himself out, and walks re fast to the diving board (taking off his glasses to impre her as he passes.)  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him?    50     YEAH-YEAH (WORRIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't-know, but that's the deep end, and Squints can't swim!  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: walks the plank to the end. Looks wantingly toward  THE LIFEGUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who smiles back at him.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: holds his nose. Takes the deep leap. Hits the water and..  UNDERWATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sinks like a stone. Squints grins as he founders.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lines the edge of the deep section.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints!  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! He's drowning!  THE LIFEGUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to the rescue. Seconds pass... she surfaces and lays a li SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody at the pool gathers 'round. The Lifeguard lays Squints flat. She administers mouth-to-mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang watches on tense as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints peeks at them through a secretly opened eye. As t Lifeguard is "saving" his sneaky life, Squints can no lon restrain himself, he grabs her - gives her a sloppy SMOOC She tears away. Stands up over his wimpy little form:  LIFEGUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little pervert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs Squints by the scruff of the neck. Run-walks hi toward the exit, and... 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...chucks his boney butt into the hedges. The guys scramb out, dragging their clothes after them. They help Squints up.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you plan that?!  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'course I did. Been plannin' it for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let Squints walk out front:  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael "Squints" Palledorous walked a little taller that day. And we had to tip our hats to him. He was lucky she hadn't beat the crap out of him. We wouldn't have blamed her. What he'd done was sneaky, rotten and low. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And cool. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another one among us would've ever, even for a million dollars, had the guts to put the move on the Lifeguard. He did. He had kissed a woman. And he kissed her long and good. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got banned from the pool forever that day... but every time we walked by after that, the Lifeguard looked down from her watchtower, right over at Squints... and smiled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty pours over his "Baseball Stuff To Remember" list: Maury Wills, 3. Mickey Mantle, 4. Willie Mays, 5. Hank Aa 6. Stan Musial, 7. Lou Brock, 8. Luis Aparicio, 9. Brooks Robinson, 10. Frank Robinson, 11. Bob Uecker. Right Field near the green fence. Left Field is in the left. Double p gets two outs. Triple play is impossible. Single is good. Double is better. Home run is best. And, ominously, "Don' get in a pickle or you're dead!" And one entry that's dou question marked: 1. The Great Bambino??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guys play in magic hour. CRACK!     52     BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jolts a high fly to  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in right field. No problem now. He backpedals, judging. CLOSER TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: then, SNATCH! Scotty makes a clean catch.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gives Scotty "Thumbs Up." Just as  SCOTTY'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gonna throw the ball back, he shivers, noticing that the has fallen to a precise declination; its rays focused beh the glowing green fiberglass of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: against which a hulking black form rises in the backyard. blocking out the sun against the panels. A gargantuan sha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow vanishes. TRIBAL DRUMS SOUND far in the distan The oleander bushes rustle menacingly, like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. JUNGLE - B&W - NIGHT - (ORIGINAL "KING KONG," 1932 - STOCK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a wall of tropical foliage. Frightening. Primordial. (NOTE: the scene with NATIVES atop the wall when Kong gra Fay Wray.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE PROJECTOR SCREEN King Kong rips through the jungle  THE GANG'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: here with 100 OTHER BOYS at the afternoon show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang gathers. Ham bursts out behind the gang as Kong!    53     HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eee! Eee! Eee! Oh! Oh! Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys SCREAM - spin to face the Ham. He BUSTS UP.  HAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, check me out! I'm the mighty King Kong! (DODGING BLOWS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! C'mon! It was a joke, ya dopes! Do I _look_ like a monkey?!  A GROUP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of other kids comes out behind them. LITTLE LEAGUERS. Mat caps and shirts. The gang straightens up.  LEAGUER PUNK 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ya smell like one too. Hey guys, it's the sandlot babies!  LEAGUER PUNK 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skin yer knees lately sliding on rocks?!  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, blockhead.  LEAGUER PUNK 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do, Porter, sit on me?!  LEAGUER PUNK 1

dialogues.text: Once we got over trying to be big shots, we just stuck to what we could handle, and swore off the hard stuff forever. When we finally got back together for some baseball, something amazing happened. (BEAT)
