dialogues.text: Yeah, we can.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you got 98 extra cents just layin' around at home, Smalls?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I got a ball.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BASEBALL on a silver pedestal (Bill's baseball). Scotty HAND ENTERS FRAME. His indecisive FINGERS almost touch th ball... then, SNATCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty dashes across the schoolyard.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) I got it! Let's play!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the ball to  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who catches it.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitchin'. Your ball, your ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny hands Scotty the bat, heads to right field, leaving  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: alone at home plate with Ham (the catcher).  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tosses DeNunez the ball on his way by.   72     DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: almost misses it. He rounds up, throws to  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at 1st. Bertram throws to  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at 2nd. Timmy almost drops it. There's a smudge on the ba Timmy tosses to  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at 3rd. Repeat fires to  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in left. The ball caroms off Yeah-Yeah's glove, comes dow fast! Yeah-Yeah barehands it. Safe. He launches to  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in center. It's gonna be short! Squints sprints - Willy Mays basket catch. He throws to DeNunez.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: digs in.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batter up!  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fires. Scotty swings - WHIFF. Again - whif. Once more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Goodnight, Irene! Scotty drops the bat. Trots for first base in "home run" fashion.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: backpeddles.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watches him, slowing, worrying.  THE BALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drops over the green fiberglass fence.     73     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stops dead in the base path.  THE GANG  CHEERS:  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice crank, Smalls.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decent cut.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's outta here! Who's got the big bat now, boys!  GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smalls. Smalls. Smalls. Smalls.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is drawn to the fence with mounting terror.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: starts over.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's he doing?  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the shock of his first homer was just too much for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty runs right up to it - clutches desperately. Pantin Trembling. The guys arrive. Scotty turns back to them... has aged 25 years.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get that ball back.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! Good one, Smalls.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. We'll just hop over and say, excuse me Mr. Beast sir, could we have our ball back, oh, and please don't kill us while we're here!    74     BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a great shot, but forget about it... game's over. We'll get another ball.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand!  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we do. You feel bad 'cause you belted a homer, and now we can't play no more.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You don't understand! THAT WASN'T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of something moving in the backyard. Just a rippling shad and trailing dust accompanying it over the fence top.  THE GANG'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eyes go to Scotty.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadda you mean it wasn't your ball?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my stepdad's. I stole it from his trophy room. It was a present or soemthing - somebody gave it to him. We have to get it back. He's gonna kill me!  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smalls... listen to me. This is a matter of life and death. (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did your old man get that ball?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno... I think some lady gave it to him.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some lady?...  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she even signed her name on it. (THE END)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some lady named Ruth... Baby Ruth.    75     EYEBALLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pop from their sockets.  GANG

dialogues.speaker: BAAAYYYBE RUUUUUTH
dialogues.text: THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sprints for the fence. Scramble up it. Just their eyes pe over the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a baseball in a little impact crater. A ball that has mos clearly been autographed by... BABE RUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, hideous forelimb thrusts from 'neath the lean-to. massive paw-thing comes down on the ball. Drags it slowly away... leaving a baseball-deep furrow in the dirt. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CANINE "LAUGHTER" comes again...  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drops from the fence - turn to face Scotty.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beast got it.  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead as a doornail, Smalls.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead as a doornail, Smalls.  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice knowing you.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice knowing -  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - shut up, Tommy. (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smalls, you mean to tell me you went home and swiped a ball that was signed by Babe Ruth, and brought it out here and actually played with it?  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And actually played with it?!     76     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I was gonna put it back.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it was signed by Babe Ruth!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who is she?!  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! What?! (OVERCOME)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?!  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sultan of Swat!  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King of Krash!  REPEAT/TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colossus of Clout!  GANG

dialogues.speaker: BABE RUTH
dialogues.text: HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for good measure) The Great Bambino!  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that did it)

dialogues.speaker: OH, MY GOD
dialogues.text: BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Smalls, Babe Ruth is the greatest baseball player that ever lived. People say he was less than a God, but more than a man. Ya know... like Hercules or somethin'. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball that you just aced to The Beast is worth... well, more than your whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty falls to his knees. Grabs his stomach.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all step back, expecting the worst. Then, they fan h with their baseball caps.     77     SCOTTY (CONT'D) (HEARTFELT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get that ball back.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does your old man get home from work?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone on business for a week.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we need 98 cents. So, everybody spread out and find some soda bottles and cash 'em in. We need a new baseball.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny's hand signs B A B E R U T H across the leather in ridiculous chicken scrawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FIVE & DIME - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgery in progress. Benny does the honors.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, Benny-man.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, it's pretty crappy.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't gonna buy that, Benny. It doesn't look anything like the Babe's signature.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter what it looks like. His mom's never gonna know the difference. This'll just buy us some time, ya dorks.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's HAND ENTERS FRAME. Little anxious FINGERS wrappe around the phony "Babe Ruth" baseball. The second the bal is back on its pedestal:     78

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Scotty?  DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty whips 'round like he's been slapped by a wet macke Mom's in the doorway.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?!  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, what are you doing in here?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... just looking at Bill's - I mean Dad's baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty hurries away from the "autographed" ball.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he doesn't like you touching his things.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. Sorry, Mom.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he ever told you about that ball?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh - no, not really, I don't think so - no, he hasn't at all - I don't know _anything_ about it.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's signed by Babe Ruth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet mother of - Mom knows! Scotty may collapse.  MOM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the greatest baseball player that ever lived.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... really?  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure is. Dad's father gave it to him. Maybe someday, he'll give it to you.   79     SCOTTY (DAZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... neat.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was salt in an open wound. Even my own mom, who was only a grown-up girl, knew who Babe Ruth was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang's all here. Big plans. War conference.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how do we get it back?  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was dead meat. I knew it. They knew it. We had thought that those cards Benny had gotten meant that something great was going to happen. Now I figured that they'd just meant my life was over.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just hop the fence and get it?  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Davy Stodenrous.  TIMMY/REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Toad.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I forgot. (A THOUGHT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey? Why don't we just go over there and knock on the door, and ask Mr. Mertle to get it for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Scotty - the kid just sprouted a dunce  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you outta your mind?! Mr. Mertle is the meanest old man that ever lived! He's the one that sicked The Beast on The Toad! (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not an option, Smalls. Forget about it.   80     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent moments... not a single blinking idea between them Then, suddenly:  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to assess the situation!  GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (better than nothing) Of course! Right! Good one, Squints! Access (sic) the situation! Okay!  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Squints? How do we do that?  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First we survey the enemy's environment, then we make note of the surrounding terrain.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...  SQUINTS (COPPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that on "Combat." Let's just look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang pokes their heads-only through the window. They look down into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is a godforsaken stucco'd corpse.  THE YARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is the final resting place for: melted frisbees, withered kickballs, skeletons of heat-crumbled paper kites, an air of exposure-splintered balsa wood gliders, and a fleet of model rockets - their drag-chutes turning to dust. And hundreds of little empty craters - that used to cradle baseballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: snakes through the dirt - buried then exposed. It termina 'NEATH     81     THE LEAN-TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from under which rises hazy twirls of dust. The dust is k from ever settling by some enormous ORGANIC EXHAUST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: emerges from under the lean-to, pushing the Babe Ruth autographed cowhide into full view - "I dare you..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys jerk their heads back inside.  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's darin' us!  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's darin' us!  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waitin' for us, man. Just like he did with The Toad.  GANG (REVERENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Toad.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on his territory now.  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he's pissed?  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Doby Gillis a dork? Anybody got any bright ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tree house debate. Much shouting. Much disagreement. Many hands miming mechanical contraptions.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had absolutely no idea what the hell we were gonna do. So things started primitively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang hurries out from the Timmons' yard carrying a br stick. They wriggle it under the fiberglass fence. Squint peers through the peep hole motioning directions to Ham. Suddenly - SNAP! Ham pulls the stick back. 'Tis toothpick 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys fell the clothes line pole with a hack saw. 6 fe of inch thick pipe. They heft it up - go out to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and shove the pipe under the green fiberglass. HORRIBLE S ERUPT from the Badlands. Dust mushrooms over the fence. T pipe draws under in FEROCIOUS JERKS. Gone. Moments. The pole sails back over the fence - bounces on the asphalt w ANGRY CLANGS. 'Tis pretzel'd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bertram arrives. Hands "it" over. How embarrassing:  BERTRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't mine. I told you, it's my little sister's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Cootie Toy. They

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: putting a hunk of chewed 'zooka on each Cootie foot. Atta it to a plastic parachute - ah-ha! Genius. An airborne assault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints indicates "go."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GANG  DRIFTS THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: out the tree house window. It floats silently toward the baseball. The Cootie lands right on the Babe Ruth. The gu sticks.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hauls it in.  THE BALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly rises. Suddenly     83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erupt from 'neath the lean-to and CHOMP the Cootie whole. The string snaps.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulls up the frayed end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a War Room. Map of the Badlands: crazed trajectories, distances to The Beast, etc. Coffee can PBX system. Cardb periscope. X's on a calendar counting down "Bill's Return The new retreival system:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: all connected. Ham's catcher's mask bolted to the end pip for ball securing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toy flashlights and BSOA lanterns hang from the structure semi-illuminating the Badlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goes the vacuumtraption, 30 feet of wobbly pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints directs the operation, looking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE the vacupipe-mask... 12 inches from the baseball.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (coffee can muffled) A-okay. Roger, affirmative. Initiate retreival suction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throw eureka switch one. WEOHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baseball moves itty-bittily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throw eureka switch two. WEEOOOHHH! 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BASEBALL moves a lot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throw eureka switch three! RRRWWEEEOOOHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baseball leaps from the ground - sticks in the catche mask collection basket.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We have suction! Pull it up! PULL IT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang reels it in. Suddenly, the whole apparatus JOLTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great beef-paw yanks the end pipe under the tree.  STEEL TEETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pinch the metal tube shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vacuums build pressure fast. WHINE crazily.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leaps from tree house.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lingers in the trap doorway a second too long:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang (minus Squints) is face down in the dirt - arms heads. The vacuums explode. Foggy clouds of dust pour out of the treehouse. Squints appears. He's battleship grey. Takes his glasses off. Only his eyes show white.  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been going about this all wrong. I blame myself. We need total surprise. (MORE)   85     SQUINTS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Therefore, we tunnel. The Beast will never expect it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all wield a shovel, and have flashlights taped t their baseball caps like coal miners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlight beam at the fore, Scotty crawls with a safety 'round his waist. He pokes the cardboard periscope up thr the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Badlands from ULTRA LOW ground level. WE SCAN 360 deg Suddenly, the scan stops. The name B A B E R U T H, FILLS the periscope's lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's hand feels for the Babe Ruth. He grabs it. It's slimey.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (SUBTERRANEAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball SQUIRTS out of his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: beneath the lean-to. It hits  THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the nose. With a SEISMIC ROAR The Beast leaps out. WE DON'T SEE MUCH. He's too big. We're too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah SHOUTS to Ham at the tunnel entrance.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's huge - oh, my God! It's huge - pull him out! It's huge! PULL HIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BEAST'S JAWS dive toward Scotty's hand. They get with an inch of Scotty's hand, and his fingers vanish - THWOOO 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang pulls Scotty out of the hole. Yeah-Yeah is unconscious on the grass. The guys turn a hose on him. He comes 'round SCREAMING:  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's huge - pull him out! Oh God, it's like a dinosaur! Wh - Wh - Where am I?!  SQUINTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah! Get hold of yourself! What'd you see?!  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accelerating to lunacy) Oh-oh, it was like hugeness and darkness and like the world was ending and the devil came up through the ground and the - and the - and the -  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - somebody slap him quick! We're losin' him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAP-WHAP! Squints administers. Yeah-Yeah snaps out of it  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I needed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Construction completes. A kid crane. A tricycle, block 'n tackle, fishing-pole n' body harness. In a line, the guys step on and off a scale. Everybody stares at Yeah-Yeah.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, I know - I'm lightest. But I ain't goin' over there! NO WAY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes to the ground.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Smalls. It was a good idea anyway.  DENUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, tough luck, Smalls.  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be that bad, Smalls. Your dad'll probably only shoot you or something.   87     YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-hey, don't blame me! I didn't hit the ball over there, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Yeah-Yeah considers.  YEAH-YEAH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, okay. But if I say pull me up, you guys better PULL ME UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny takes Yeah-Yeah aside. Hands him all over Ham's catcher's gear.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Put these on.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha -? Why? Whadda I need All this stuff for Benny? I mean, why a mask and a gonad Protector?  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, ah, nuthin', ya know, just For, ah... Altitude leveling And stuff. Put it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny hurries off as Timmy and Repeat approach with a frightening looking harnass assembly. Yeah-Yeah backs awa  TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We're professionals.  REPEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Dad's a contractor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAM'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: strapped in at the tricycle winch.  YEAH-YEAH'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dangling over the lean-to.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into can phone) Okay-okay, I'm right over it. Let me down - slow!  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lets go. Oops. WHIZZZZ!    88     YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: plummets.  YEAH-YEAH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! Stop! STOP!  HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: back-cranks.  YEAH-YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes to a twirling halt four feet off the ground.  YEAH-YEAH'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: into the lean-to. Blackness and dust.  YEAH-YEAH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay-'kay, tip me, hurry up. I'm gettin' the woollies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah reaches... Gets it!  YEAH-YEAH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: comes tumbling down - bending into flimsy knots as it CRA

dialogues.text: Scotty stands alone on the tree house roof... staring dow into the Badlands. A little, wrecked shell of a kid, who now dead meat. The guys look up at him sorrowfully.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life was over. Just as Bill had finally warmed up to me, and asked me to be the man of the house, I had to knock a priceless chunk of history into the clutches of a monster. Great.

dialogues.text: Suddenly, a RACKET from inside Benny's closet. A bright L GOES ON in there. Then, smoke comes out.

dialogues.text: M - M - Mom?...

dialogues.text: Now don't go peeing your pants or nuthin', I'm just here to give ya a hand.

dialogues.text: ...dead? Legends never die, kid.

dialogues.text: Benny comes off the wall. The enormous Ruth towers over h  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really him. You're The Babe. The Sultan of Swat. The King -     94     THE BABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - of Krash and a hundred other dopey names. Forget about that, we ain't got much time. I'm here 'cause you're in some kinda pickle, right?  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  THE BABE

dialogues.text: A baseball with my John Hancock on it went over a fence, and you can't get it back. Right?  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.  THE BABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clear and simple) Then just hop over there and get it. There ya go. Problem solved. (tips his cap) See ya, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Babe turns to go back to wherever he came from. Benny grabs his arm - shocked that he actually feels something "real."  BENNY

dialogues.text: Wait! I can't.  THE BABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't what?  BENNY

dialogues.text: Go into that backyard.  THE BABE

dialogues.text: What kind?  BENNY

dialogues.text: A giant gorilla-dog-thing that ate one kid already.  THE BABE

dialogues.text: Is that a fact? Listen to me, kid. (MORE)    95

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everybody gets one chance to do something great. Most people either never take the chance 'cause they're too scared, or they don't recognize it when it spits on their shoes. (BEAT)

dialogues.text: This is your "big chance," and ya shouldn't let it go by. (PAUSE)

dialogues.text: Remember those cards you got the other day?  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're the odds on that?  BENNY

dialogues.text: About a zillion to one.  THE BABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More even. Someone's tellin' you somethin', kid. And if I was you... I'd listen.  BENNY

dialogues.text: Yeah, but what?  THE BABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one with the rubba legs. Figure it out. (BEAT)

dialogues.text: You gotta do what your heart tells you, else you'll spend the rest of your life wishin' you had.  BENNY

dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure ya did, Babe.  THE BABE

dialogues.text: Not a chance. Matter of fact, all the way down to first I kept sayin' to myself, "you lucky bum." (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about that, kid. I'll see ya later.

dialogues.text: The Babe disappears back into the closet, then:

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Remember, kid. There's heroes and there's Legends. Heroes get remembered... but Legends never die. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow your heart, kid, and you'll never go wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Easy. Easy, boy.  THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: whimpers. Scotty balances atop the fence. Grabs the tow chain. Lifts with all his might... his fingers bleed. The Beast goes limp. An inch. That did it! The beast falls.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goes with him - 8 feet to the dirt. The FENCE COMES DOWN breaking the barrier to the sandlot. He lands on the grou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with The Beast.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leaps to his feet.  THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rises with him.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: freezes solid.   106     THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watches in horror.  THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: scans them instinctively - He might kill them all where t stand.  SCOTTY'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: about to load up his fruit o' da looms.  THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sticks his mammoth head right in Scotty's face. SNIFFS. T it! The kid is lunch! His jowls part - hot BEAST-BREATH BLOWS Scotty's hair back.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: closes his eyes.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAP their hands to their eyesockets.  THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leans closer. Mouth opens. Cold-leather nose presses agai Scotty's forehead. Then... He licks Scotty's face.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wipes away the Beast slob. He doesn't even have to kneel down to read the name on The Beast's "doggy tag." It says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Hercules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time Scotty gives Benny "Thumbs Up."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hercules digs, then stands away.  THE GANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: steps closer. Look into the hole. Their faces light up wi wonder. In  THE HOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are 150 baseballs.    107

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG'S BLOWN AWAY
dialogues.text: BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can play forever now.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes The Beast by the collar. He and Benny go to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty KNOCKS. MR. MERTLE answers the door. An old man wi dark glasses. He comes out on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: Hello?...  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, we brought your dog home.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: Hercules? How'd he get out?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir... um, we kind of, well, what happened was -  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - we hit a baseball into your yard. Then we tried to get it and -

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: - why didn't you just come to the door... I'd have gotten it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints, Yeah-Yeah, Ham, DeNunez, Repeat, Timmy and Bertr faint.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for bringin' him back. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you boys come in... we can talk about baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairly spartan, except for one room, where it seems that Mertle spends most of his time. He leads Benny and Scotty INTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle sits at a table. Benny and Scotty stare at the tabletop.   108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It holds a scale model Baseball Diamond: green felt field little bases, outfield wall and miniature player figures. picture on the wall of Mr. Mertle and Babe Ruth.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew Babe Ruth?

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. And he knew me too. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never let us play together, but we were friends. Good friends. He was almost as great a hitter as I was. But, he'd of told you he was better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture is signed: "To Thelonius Johnson Mertle, the greatest slugger I ever saw... Babe Ruth."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baseball game on the RADIO. As each play is CALLED, Mr. Mertle's hands deftly put his tiny players in the correct positions. Mr. Mertle is blind.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (HOLDING BALL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the one that went over my fence?  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle brushes his fingers over the leather.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: This is an old ball, boys. Really old. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hercules gave it a good chewing, didn't he?  SCOTTY (WEAK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: You sound upset, son - what's wrong?  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you see... that ball belongs to my stepdad... and, uh - it was signed by Babe Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle shakes his head... hands the ball to Scotty.   109

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: Hmm. Well, I'm sure your dad will understand.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the RADIO, Wills steals second.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: (TO BENNY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, move Maury Wills to second base for me, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny moves the little figure to second base.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If he steals third that'll be number 100. (TO SCOTTY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva pickle you're in, boy.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle retrieves something from a glass case. A baseb

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: I'll make you a deal. If you boys come over once a week and talk baseball with me, I'll trade you balls.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's really nice of you... but this ball really is signed by The Babe.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: (CHUCKLES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one really is too... and all the rest of the '27 Yankees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands his baseball to Scotty... Benny stares at it in disbelief.  BENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God - Murderers' Row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they ogle the ball:  BENNY (CONT'D) (AWED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou Gehrig...     110     SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty hands Mr. Mertle the chewed up Babe Ruth ball. Sha his hand.  SCOTTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the RADIO, Maury Wills steals 3rd for his 100th stolen base. Scotty notices the wall clock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's car is in the driveway. Scotty goes up the walkway slowly. Benny just behind him. The gang lingers at the sidewalk. Scotty sets one foot on the  PORCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Bill comes out. He looks none-too-pleased. He towers over Scotty. The gang hangs their heads.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny unpockets a little felt bag. Hands it to Scotty. He holds the bag up to a perplexed Bill, who opens it. He lo from Scotty to Benny and back again. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stares down at the "Murderers' Row" ball.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BASEBALL sailing through the air. SMACK! it's caught in brand new glove. Scotty's new glove. Scotty snap throws t ball back to Bill. He and Scotty are having a great game catch.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was weird that Benny said Babe Ruth was like the Hercules of baseball, and then The Beast's name turned out to be Hercules. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was also strange that Mr. Mertle had a Murderers' Row ball to replace the one signed by The Babe.   111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Scotty smile as they fire the cowhide back and f  NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people might say that it was all a coincidence... but looking back at it now, it seems like everything was connected, just like me and Benny. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like we were a part of the same myth as The Babe... the Myth of Baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's mom sticks her head out the back door. She smile watching her "two boys" toss the ball around.  MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, supper's ready.  DAD (FORMERLY BILL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us another ten minutes. I'm helpin' my boy break in his new glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle sits contentedly behind his little "diamond." RADIO ANNOUNCER calls Maury Wills' 104th steal of 1962.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS HAND moves a wooden figure from 1st to 2nd. This tact

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "playing field" becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...this one, where the guys are playing ball. There's a n addition to their team. A mascot. A big mascot.  HERCULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in a t-shirt and cap.  THE GUYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: all play as if, somehow, this may be the last time they e get to be a team. As they play, they're "sponged" from th PICTURE in this order: Yeah-Yeah, Repeat and Timmy, Ham, DeNunez, Bertram, Squints, Hercules, Scotty, Benny.  NARRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the last summer that we all got to play together. (MORE)   112     NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it would stay with us forever. (as they all dissolve:) Yeah-Yeah's parents shipped him off to military school. Timmy and Tommy grew up to build skyscrapers. Ham went to college and became a pediatrician. DeNunez played triple A ball and never got to the majors. Bertram got really into the sixities and no one ever saw him again. Squints grew up and married Wendy Peffercorn; they bought the Five & Dime and they still own it to this day. Hercules lived to be 199 years old... in human years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone but Benny has vanished from the Sandlot.  NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Benny pickled the Beast, his reputation spread all over town. From then on he was known as Benny "The Juet" Rodriguez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes down on home plate and vanishes, leaving  THE SANDLOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: empty.  NARRATOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nickname stuck with him the rest of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodger stadium. A ROAR goes up inside the ballpark.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (FAMILIAR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a triple, and that'll put the winning run on third, with two out in the bottom of the ninth. What a shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the dugout, TOMMY LASORDA calls for a pinch runner. PLAYER comes out of the dugout, stripping off his warm-up jacket.   113

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lasorda's sending in a pinch runner - and it'll be... (DRAMATIC PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it! Lasorda's calling up the "Old Man" to pinch-run in the biggest clutch situation this season! They say the veteran's lost a step or two. But if I were you, I'd get ready for some fireworks.  THE CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is on its feet as 40-year-old BENNY "THE JET" RODRIGUEZ t over third base from the PLAYER already there. They shake hands on the exchange. The 3rd base COACH walks over to T Jet. Pats him on the back.  COACH (GRINNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give 'em hell, Jet.  THE JET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my best, Maury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coach moves into the coaching box... turning his back us. Emblazoned across his jersey, is the name W I L L S.  THE PITCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes the signal.  THE JET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leads off 3rd base - ten steps! The Pitcher fires to 3rd. The Jet hand tags.  THE PITCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: settles.  THE JET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leads off. Eleven steps.  THE PITCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fires to 3rd again. The Jet gets back.  THE JET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leads off again. Twelve steps. The pitch - strike. The CATCHER tosses it back. Just then...    114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The Jet moves. So fast that no one knows he's gone til it's too damn late. The Pitcher awkwardly throws home. Th Catcher wipes the baseline. Too late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the dust clears. The UMPIRE eagle-wings the air.  UMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tag missed by two feet. It's all over. The Crowd jump to its feet. The Dodger dugout is all over The Jet.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Dodgers win the pennant! The Dodgers win the pennant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jet breaks through his adoring teammates just long en to give "Thumbs Up" to...

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't believe it, the Old Man stole home! The Old Man -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...39-year-old SCOTT SMALLS - The Announcer - who returns "Thumbs Up."  SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) The Jet stole home! The Jet stole home!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jet signs autographs for swarming KIDS. As the CROWD' CHEERING CONTINUES and ECHOES into the past, we  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the 9 best (11-year-old) buddies that ever lived. On a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: makeshit baseball diamond - a sandlot... circa 1962. They all holding something forward - displaying - one palm up, hand beneath another - together like the nine musketeers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baseball. A baseball with a familiar smudge.

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT.
dialogues.text: THE END
